STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
November 17, 2021
Kathleen Schultz
Wellspring Lutheran Services Bay City
6019 W Side Saginaw
Bay City, MI 48707
RE: License #: CB090201254
Wellspring Lutheran Services Bay City
6019 W Side Saginaw
Bay City, MI 48707
Dear Ms. Schultz:
Your Child Placing Agency license is renewed. It is valid only at your present address
and is nontransferable. If you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
You will be receiving the license in the mail. Please review it for accuracy.
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
11/15/2021. The study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Modified Implementation, Sustainability
and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements. It should be noted that violations of any licensing
rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. As indicated above substantial
compliance has been established therefore, your license is renewed.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request or require consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan for the interim evaluation completed
03/18/2021. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that evaluation were R
400.12324 (8), and R 400.12421 (b). Neither of these areas were identified as
repeat noncompliance as a part of this renewal evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment provided a review of the agency’s progress in
meeting the metric goals, the impact of COVID in providing services, and a review of
identified licensing citations and the agency’s plans to correct identified deficiencies.
Interviews
Child welfare staff participated in entrance and exit conferences and no concerns
were noted
2

VI. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
11/15/2021
________________________________________
Mark R. Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
November 17, 2021

Claudia Triestram Date
